results.name: Triangle from inverse scaled Pochhammer symbols.
comment: This expansion is based on the partial fraction identity: 1/Product_{j=1..m}(x+j) = (1 + Sum_{j=1..m} (-1)^j*binomial(m,j)*x/(x+j))/m!, e.g., p. 37 of the Jordan reference.
Another version of this triangle (without a column of 1's) is A008969.
The column sequences are, for m=1..10: A000012 (powers of 1), A000225, A001240, A001241, A001242, A111886-A111888.
The triangle occurs as U-factor in the LDU-decomposition of the matrix M defined by m(r,c)=1/(1+r)^c (r, c beginning at 0).
An explicit expansion based on this can be made by defining a "recursive harmonic number" (rhn). (This representation is just a heuristic pattern-interpretation, no analytic proof yet available).
h(k,0)=1      for k>0      as rhn of order zero(0).
then the upper triangular triangle A:=a(r,c) for c-r>0
reference: Charles Jordan, Calculus of Finite Differences, Chelsea, 1965.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
L. M. Smiley, Completion of a Rational Function Sequence of Carlitz, arXiv:0006106 [math.CO], 2000.
formula: G.f. of column k: x^k/Product_{j=0..k} (j+1 - x) = Sum_{n>=k} T(n,k)*x^k/(k+1)!^(n-k+1). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 20 2012
T(n,k) = (k+1)!^(n-k+1) * [x^n] x^k / Product_{j=0..k} (j+1 - x). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 20 2012
G.f. of row n: Sum_{j>=0} (j+1)^(j-n-1) * exp((j+1)*x) * (-x)^j/j! = Sum_{k>=0} T(n,k)*x^k/(k+1)!^(n-k+1). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 20 2012
T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1 and T(n,k) = (k+1)^(n-k)*T(n-1,k-1)+(k!)*T(n-1,k) for 0<k<n. - _Werner Schulte_, Dec 14 2016
